Motor¶

class motor.Motor(PWM: tuple[pyb.Timer, int, pyb.Pin], DIR: pyb.Pin, nSLP: pyb.Pin, startup: int)¶

A motor driver interface encapsulated in a Python class. Works with motor drivers using separate PWM and direction inputs such as the DRV8838 drivers present on the Romi chassis from Pololu.

Initializes a Motor object

Parameters:

  • PWM – Information required to set up PWM pin (Timer,channel_num, Pin)

  • DIR – Direction Pin

  • nSLP – not Sleep Pin

  • startup – Start up voltage for the motor

DIR_pin¶

Motor driver direction pin

PWM_pin¶

Motor driver PWM TimerChannel object

Startup_V¶

Motor start up voltage

disable()¶

Disables the motor driver by taking it into sleep mode

enable()¶

Enables the motor by taking it out of sleep mode, into brake mode

nSLP_pin¶

Motor driver NOT sleep (Enable) Pin

set_effort(effort: int)¶

Sets the present effort for a motor object

Parameters:

effort – Integer between -100 and 100, the percent effort to the motor

MECHA03 ROMI
